abstract: An analysis of U.S. federal documents showed that many Camrys built before 2007 — and not covered in recent recalls — were linked to speed control problems.
snippet: An analysis of U.S. federal documents showed that many Camrys built before 2007 — and not covered in recent recalls — were linked to speed control problems.
lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Bill Vlasic, Hiroko Tabuchi and Jo Craven McGinty and written by Mr. Vlasic.

headline.main: Data Shows Camrys Outside Recall Also Had Problems
headline.print_headline: Data Shows Control Problems In Toyotas Beyond Big Recall

byline.original: By Bill Vlasic, Hiroko Tabuchi and Jo Craven McGinty

abstract: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration receives more than 30,000 complaints each year that capture more than 40 data points.
snippet: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration receives more than 30,000 complaints each year that capture more than 40 data points.
lead_paragraph: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration receives more than 30,000 complaints each year. About 70 percent are filed through the agency’s Web site online, while the rest are submitted by e-mail, regular mail or through calls to the administration’s hot line.

abstract: Some press commentary in Japan has said Toyota was being unfairly punished by an administration eager to bolster the fortunes of the Detroit carmakers.
snippet: Some press commentary in Japan has said Toyota was being unfairly punished by an administration eager to bolster the fortunes of the Detroit carmakers.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Ever since the Transportation Department stepped up pressure on Toyota over its recalls several months ago, two delicate questions have hung over regulators: Is the Obama administration trying to help the Detroit carmakers it bailed out last year by attacking Toyota? And, will those attacks lead to new trade tensions with Japan?

headline.main: Growing Criticism of Toyota Feeds Fears of Antagonism Toward Japan
headline.print_headline: Growing Criticism of Toyota Feeds Fears of Antagonism Toward Japan

abstract: Zhongsheng Group, a Chinese dealership which provides services for automakers including Toyota, on Tuesday put off a $1 billion Hong Kong initial public offering, citing volatile market conditions, Reuters reported.
snippet: Zhongsheng Group, a Chinese dealership which provides services for automakers including Toyota, on Tuesday put off a $1 billion Hong Kong initial public offering, citing volatile market conditions, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Zhongsheng Group, a Chinese dealership that provides services for automakers, including Toyota, put off a $1 billion Hong Kong initial public offering on Tuesday, citing volatile market conditions, Reuters reported.

headline.main: China Car Dealer Zhongsheng Defers $1 Billion I.P.O.

abstract: The system would be meant to prevent acceleration episodes like those that have led to the recall of millions of Toyotas, said Ray LaHood, the transportation secretary.
snippet: The system would be meant to prevent acceleration episodes like those that have led to the recall of millions of Toyotas, said Ray LaHood, the transportation secretary.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration may recommend that carmakers install a brake override system that is intended to prevent the sudden acceleration episodes that have led to recalls of millions of Toyotas, the transportation secretary, Ray LaHood, said on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Studies A Backup For Brakes

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

abstract: The company, estimating that it lost 18,000 sales in the United States last month, offered no-interest financing for five years on eight models and low lease rates on nine.
snippet: The company, estimating that it lost 18,000 sales in the United States last month, offered no-interest financing for five years on eight models and low lease rates on nine.
lead_paragraph: Toyota Motor, estimating that it lost 18,000 sales in the United States last month while its chief competitors enjoyed big gains, introduced incentives Tuesday as it tried to restore consumers’ confidence in its vehicles after three big recalls.

headline.main: After Recalls, Toyota Offers Incentives to Win Back Wary Customers
headline.print_headline: After Recalls, Toyota Offers Incentives to Win Back Wary Customers
